resources.string: Please restart the Barobot Application. If that doesn\'t work please restart tablet.
Unplug MicroUSB cable from tablet and plug it back. If it doesn\'t work try restart the appliaction using button below.
Connect Barobot to the power supply and switch it ON. Connect DC wire to tablet.
Connect USB-mini USB adapter (host adapter) to tablet and to Barobot
Connect tablet to your local WiFi. Slide down top right corner and select WiFi logo to show more options.
Move slider to calibrate arm\'s back position
Move slider to calibrate arm\'s front position

Adjust front and rear positions. Robot should touch edges gently. Loud banging means that arm tries to go too far front or back. Poor alignment can cause premature damage of the servomotors. If something goes really wrong just turn robot OFF and remove the obstacle..

Move the carriage so that is not under any of the dispensers. Check if the upper and lower positions match with the picture. If top position is too low dispensers won\'t be pressed hard enough for smooth pouring. If down position is too high carriage will hit dispensers during left-right movement.
Move slider to calibrate servo in UP position
Move slider to calibrate servo in DOWN position
Remove Glass Tray and press measure button:
Put the Glass Tray back and press measure button:
"Left-right calibration: Barobot will move carriage from left to right and collect data from magnetic field sensor. Green color under the bottles indicates that dispenser position was found."
If new version is available please download it and install. WiFi connection is required.
Now check left - right motor. If carriage moves properly click Next

If something goes wrong just turn robot OFF using power switch and remove obstacle, check: if pulley is firmly attached to the shaft; sequence of stepper motor wiring at the mainboard (and if the screwing touches actual wire and not the insulation); if motor driver sits firmly in the mainboard socket.
Test completed successfully. Click Next to continue.
Test completed successfully. Click Next to continue.
Look at the robot from the front and then...
- move carriage gently to the extreme left and click Check left button
- move carriage gently to the extreme right and click Check right button
Do left glass tray lights blink white?
Do right glass tray lights blink white?
Now, do all robot lights blink white?
Test completed successfully. Click Next to continue.
Turn robot OFF and check LEDs wires. Check against the manual if cables are attached in the right sequence.
Turn robot OFF and check the wire that connect left and right panel. Isn\'t it flooded with liquid?
Turn robot OFF and check LEDs wires. Check against the manual if cables are attached in the right sequence.
Test completed successfully. Click Next to continue.
Sensor error. Turn OFF barobot and check wires. Maybe they are inserted too deeply to connector. Check also wire order against the manual.
Difference is to small. Did you followed the wizard?
Test completed successfully without error. Click Next to continue.
Click Refresh. If it doesn\'t help turn OFF Barobot using main power switch and turn it ON again. Check small red light on Carriage board. Check main-bus.
Please upload firmware using "Software update" wizard. If something still wont work please use "Manual update".
Is sensor connected? Check against the manual if cables are attached in the right sequence. Isn\'t it flooded with liquid?
Is sensor connected? Check against the manual if cables are attached in the right sequence. Isn\'t it flooded with liquid?
Is load cell connected? Check against the manual if cables are attached in the right sequence.
If temperature is to high turn OFF robot as soon is possible and check against the manual if all cables are attached in the right sequence.

Move carriage left and right and check value below. It should vary for each magnet. You should see "X max position" on extreme right, "Start Position" on extreme left and "front" or "back" below other magnets. If not - check sensor, wires and magnets.
Test completed successfully. Click Next to continue.
Error 80. No Hall Y sensor. Turn robot OFF and check wires. Isn\'t it flooded with liquid?
Error 81. Front magnet was not found
Error 82. Back magnet was not found.
Error 83. Neutral value error. Can Servo Y move? Sensor value in middle position is wrong. Turn robot OFF and check wires.
Error 85. Hall Y sensor connector is probably inverted or servo Y didn\'t move. Turn robot OFF and check wires.
Error 86. Two magnets found but front manget is upside-down. Turn robot OFF and check magnet.
